Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: Hello, I forgot o update my address, can you help me with that?

hi, you have to report any change of address to DMV within 10 days after moving. You should do this both for the address associated with your license and all the addresses associated with all your vehicles.
Can I do my DMV transactions online?
Yes, you can sign up for MyDMV for all the online transactions needed.
Thanks, and in case I forget to bring all of the documentation needed to the DMV office, what can I do?

This happens often with our customers so that's why our website and MyDMV are so useful for our customers. Just check if you can make your transaction online so you don't have to go to the DMV Office.
Ok, and can you tell me again where should I report my new address?
Sure. Any change of address must be reported to the DMV, that's for the address associated with your license and any of your vehicles.
Can you tell me more about Traffic points and their cost?
Traffic points is the system used by DMV to track dangerous drivers. The cost of the traffic points is independent of the DRA, so you get a separate charge based on the total points you accumulate.

Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: Will you keep me informed about when my insurance is about to lapse?
Yes. The New York State requires every motorist to maintain their insurance up to date so we at DMV make sure to inform you if you have any problem with your insurance.
Is it needed that my address is always up to date with you guys?

Yes, It is required. If not we won't be able to keep you informed about your insurance and we'll suspend your registration and license. You should make sure to turn in your vehicle's license plate before canceling your insurance policy
Can you tell me more about the traffic points and its cost?
Yes. This is the system DM uses to keep a record of dangerous drivers. The cost of the DMV charge, that it's a separate charge from the DRA, depends on the total points you accumulate.
It's always a hassle to bring all the required documents to the DMV Office. Please tell me an alternative.

This happens quite often with our customers when they don't bring some of the necessary documents or requirements to complete their transactions. The best you can do is to check our website to see if you can do your transaction online so you don't have to go to the DMV Office.
In case I have a problem with my insurance and your inquiry letter does not resolve the problem, what would happen.
In that case, we must suspend the vehicle registration and if the problem continues, your driver's license. More than 300,000 registrations a year are suspended due to failing to maintain insurance.

Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: I moved recently and forgot to update my address. Could this be a problem?
Yes, by statute, you have to report a change of address to DMV before ten days after moving.
Is it common to delay a transaction due to forgetting any prerequisite when going to the DMV office? what could be the alternative?
Yes. Around 10% of our customers forget some of the pre-requisites when going to a DMV office. To avoid this, you could check on the DMV website to see if you can do your transaction online.
What if the inquiry letter you send to me doesn't resolve the problem with my insurance?
In that case, we must suspend the vehicle registration and if the problem persists, your driver's license. This happens quite often a year due to failing to maintain insurance.
What could happen if I forget to update my new address with you guys?
If you move and don't update your address who won't know about any insurance problem and we'll have to suspend your registration and license.
Can I leave the state without notifying DMV?
Thanks to the communications between states you can resolve any previous problem you have in New York State before registering in the new state.

Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: Can you keep me up to date with my insurance so it doesn't lapse?

The New York State requires every motorist to maintain auto insurance always that a vehicle is registered, due to that, DMV works with insurance companies to monitor your insurance coverage and keep you informed.
How would you contact me about any insurance problem?
After knowing about the problem we will send you a mail with an insurance inquiry letter to allow you to solve the problem.
tell me about the cost of traffic points.
the charge you get from DMV is based on how many points you have accumulated.
tell me about the documentation I should bring when going to a DMV office.

Since many of our customers tend to forget some document or requirement for their transactions, we recommend that you go first to our website to see if you can do your transaction online, that way you can avoid any hassle from going to the DMV Office.
Would there be a problem if I leave the state without notifying DMV?
You should resolve any pending problem you have here before moving to another state, if you not, you could not get a new license in your new home state.

Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: Tell me about what can I do to not let my insurance lapse.

Since we work with the insurance company to make sure that all the vehicles maintain their insurances properly and according to the New York State requirements, we sill inform you of any problems with your insurance coverage.
What if I cancel my insurance policy?
you have to turn in your vehicle's license plates at DMV.
I more often than not tend to forget one or some of the documents needed for my transaction at the DMV Office, please tell me, is there another way to do my DMV transactions?
Yes, before going to the DMV office you should check our website to see if you can do your transaction online.
Can I just write my new address in the back of my license if I haven't updated my address at the DMV?

No, by statute, you must update your address at the DMV whenever you move from your registered address. It's not enough to just write the new address in the back of your license, or inform an officer when getting a ticket, or tell the United States Postal Service.
How will you contact me about a problem with my insurance?
When we detect any problem with your insurance, we'll mail you an insurance inquiry letter to let you resolve the problem.

Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: Can you help me with how to avoid the lapse of my insurance?
DMV is always in contact with insurance companies to electronically monitor your insurance coverage and comply with the New York State requirements.
Can I just notify the United States Postal Service about a change of address or do I have to update this info with the DMV too?
You have to keep your address up to date in the DMV. It is not enough to inform the US Postal Service.
Tell me about the mistake of not bringing the proper documentation to a DMV office.

Around 10% of our customers that visit a DMV office, forget to bring all of the requirements for their transactions. Before going to a DMV Office you should see if your transaction can be performed online, like an address change, registration renewal, and more. This way you can avoid going to a DMV Office.
what could happen in case I don't update my address in the DMV?

first, is not enough to update your address with a third party, you should keep your address updated in the DMV, if not, you could miss a suspension order and may be charged with operating an unregistered vehicle.
Tell me about the costs of traffic points.
the cost of the charge you can get from the DMV due to a traffic violation varies according your accumulated traffic points.
What else could happen if I don't update my address with you guys?.
You won't learn about any insurance problem and we'll suspend your registration and license.

Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: Is it that important to update my address at the DMV?

By statute, you must always report any change of address to the DMV within 10 days of moving. This applies for the address associated with your license and all addresses associated with your registered vehicles.
Do I have only 10 days to report a change of address?
Yes, this is required by law. You have to report your new address within ten days of moving.
How often do you send inquiry letters?
We send about 500.000 inquiry letters per year.
I want to know about the traffic points cost.
The points is the system used for the DMV to keep track of dangerous drivers. The amount you pay from a DMV charge for a traffic ticket depends on the number of accumulated points.
Isn't the DMV charge included in the DRA charge?
No, the DRA and DMV charge are separate charges.
What if I have an insurance problem and the inquiry letter does not resolve it?
In that case, we have to suspend the vehicle registration and, if the problem persists, your license.

Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: Hello, I recently moved with my family and I forgot to Update my address. I read an article about the Top 5 DMV mistakes people do, and figured out it'd be a problem if I don't update it. What can I do?

Hello. First, you have to report a change of address to DMV within ten days of having moved, for both the address associated with your license and all the addresses associated with each vehicle you have.
It's been 2 weeks since I moved. What are the consequences of not having updated my address within those ten days?
You will be charged with operating an unregistered vehicle and/or aggravated unlicensed operation.
Ok. I'll pay the charges.I have another question: I'm planning on leaving the state next month, what  are the steps I should take? I don't want to leave the state without notifying DMV

Well, you need to know that States communicate with each other, so if you leave the state without notifying DMV will be aware of that. Before leaving the state, make sure to resolve any unaswered tickets, suspensions or revocations. 
You also have to surrender your license(s) plate(s) to NYS when you get to the new state.
Ok. I suppose I have to get a new car insurance in the new state. What happens if by accident I let the insurance lapse?
DMV will suspend your registration and license.
Let's say I get to a new state, I register my vehicle, get my car insurance and all that stuff but my coverage is dropped for any reason. What would DMV do in that case?
We would send you an inquiry letter to allow you to clear up the problem. We send 500000 inquiry letters a year, so that's covered.

Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: Hi , I forget to update my adress. And What will happen now.?
You must inform your adrees change to DMV in ten days. If you are in ten days, please hurry.
If I don't, is there any serious problem for me?
Yes , in ths case you can miss a suspensin order, and so you can continue to drive an unregistered vehicle
Is it useless to inform the police officer about the situation?
No it is not sufficient. You must do more.
I didn't know that adress is so important.Is there any other matter where the address is important?
Yes There are lots of section about adress. For instance we mail insurance problems to your address.
Insurance problems? Like what. Can you explain more?
New York State wants every motorist to maintain auto insurance , and we watch your insurance status electronically
Does your insurance coverage continue?
Yes I think. I will check again.
Already, If coverage is dropped, we mail you about that. So your adress is so important.

Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: What happens if my insurance lapses?

Because we all pay indirectly for crashes involving uninsured motorists, New York State requires every motorist to maintain auto insurance every single day a vehicle is registered. DMV works with insurance companies to electronically monitor your insurance coverage
When did your insurance lapse?
Does it matter?
Yes. we mail you an insurance inquiry letter to allow you to clear up the problem
What happens if I change address?

If you fail to maintain an updated address with us you won t learn that you have an insurance problem and we will suspend your registration and license. Make sure you turn in your vehicle s license plates at DMV before you cancel your insurance policy
How much do traffic points cost?

DMV maintains a point system to track dangerous drivers. Often motorists convicted of a traffic ticket feel they have resolved all their motoring issues with the local court , but later learn that the Driver Responsibility Assessment DRA is a separate DMV charge based on the total points they accumulate
What happens if I still have a problem afer getting the inquiry letter?
we must suspend the vehicle registration
When do I need to report my address update?
you must report a change of address to DMV within ten days of moving

Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: What happens if I forget to update my address?

You must report a change of address to DMV within ten days of moving. That is the case for the address associated with your license , as well as all the addresses associated with each registered vehicle , which may differ
What happens if I forget to update my current address?
You will miss a suspension order and may be charged with operating an unregistered vehicle and/or aggravated unlicensed operation , both misdemeanors.
What happens if I have more questions after receiving the inquiry letter?
We will suspend the vehicle registration
What happens if I fail to update my address?

You will miss a suspension order and may be charged with operating an unregistered vehicle and/or aggravated unlicensed operation , both misdemeanors. This really happens but the good news is this is a problem that is easily avoidable
What happens if my insurance runs out?

Because we all pay indirectly for crashes involving uninsured motorists, New York State requires every motorist to maintain auto insurance every single day a vehicle is registered. DMV works with insurance companies to electronically monitor your insurance coverage
Has your insurance lapsed?
Yes
We mail you an insurance inquiry letter to allow you to clear up the problem

Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them.doc_id: Top 5 DMV Mistakes and How to Avoid Them#3_0

turns.utterance: I just moved.  How long do I have to update my address?
You have 10 days to update your address.
You have not updated to your current address?
Not yet, but it's only been 5 days.
Are there costs associated with traffic points?
Yes, the DRA charge is based on the number of points you have accumulated.
Are there any common mistakes people make with the DMV?
Yes, there are several common issues people have that could have been easily fixed beforehand.
Are there consequences for simple mistakes?
Yes, anything up to an impounded vehicle or encounters with law enforcement officers.
What happens if my insurance lapses?
Your license and registration will be suspended.
Will that happen automatically, or will I get a chance to reinstate my coverage first?
You will be sent an inquiry letter first, then if it isn't resolved your registration will be suspended.
Can I know if anybody asked for my records?
Yes, since the records of searches are public we'll inform any motorist if his records were searched.
it looks like my browser is not compatible with your website.
You should visit https://encryption.ny.gov/ to check the compatibility of your website and if it says that is not compatible, please update your browser.
I need to contact DMV about my dial-in search account
Our contact address for that is NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137e - mail
Sorry, it looks like my chat didn't show your message well, can you please how to tell me how to contact DMV about my dial-in search account.
ok our mail address for dial-in search account related problems is NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137
What should I do if your site says my browser is not compatible?.
First, you should update your browser to its newest version available.
What info can you give me about those that search for my DMV records?
We can supply you with the name and business address of the Dial-In account holder and the time, date and search criteria they used for the records.
Just to check the address of contact is correct please tell me if this is the right one: NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137
Yes, that's correct.
I need to know if DMV could contact me regarding my dial-in searches I do with my dial-in search account.
Yes, DMV can ask you about your dial-in searches. We do this to monitor compliance with the DIAL-IN Terms of Service.
What about if I didn't perform the search I'm asked about?

If you or any of the known users performed the search, you should contact us immediately. You have to respond to our inquiry about the dial-in search or your search privileges will be suspended until you respond.
What kind of documents or business records can I use to document my searches
Some examples are invoices, retainer agreements, consent forms, and surveillance reports, among other types of records. You should maintain these records to comply with our terms of service.
How much should I pay for the dial-in search account fees?
The first deposit have to be enough to pay for two months of searches.
What is the contact address for problems related to my dial-in search account?
you can mail the DMV to NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137
I want to know about dial-in search accounts.
I need to do searches for DMV records for driver licenses and other info. Can I use it for this?

Yes, with the Dial-in service you can actually search for records of driver licenses, registrations and other similar information at the DMV. This service is typically used by attorneys, insurance and private investigators, process servers and security personnel.
Are the records given by this service public records?
Yes, al the records of searches are public records
Will I get an account to check my application?
Yes, an account will be created for you and we'll send you your account number and password. Your account number will never change.
is there a fee for using the dial-in search account?
Yes, there's a fee that we must charge according to the NYS Vehicle and Traffic Law. This fee applies to private persons, commercial organizations and not-for-profit organizations.
Do I need anything specific if I perform a search on behalf of a client?
You'll have to show permissible use of your client and your client-agent relationship.
Can a motorist know if I searched his records using the dial-in search account?
Yes, we will if asked. All the records of searches are public.
What info would the motorist get when asking if his records were searched?
As I mentioned before, all the search records are public records.
Are your security protocols strong enough to protect the data?
Our security protocols are being upgraded to ensure the protection of your data.
Would the upgrading of the security protocols affect the compatibility of my browser?
Due to the upgrading of our security protocols, you should make sure your browser is compatible.
What kind of clients usually use the dial-in search account service?
The most common clients are attorneys, security personnel, insurance and private investigators and process servers.
How can I verify if my browser is compatible?
You can visit https://encryption.ny.gov/ , there you will be informed if your browser is incompatible.
Can you tell me about browser compatibility?
You should know that we are improving our security protocols to better protect your data.
Can you give me an address for dial-in search account consultations?
You can mail DMV at NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137
how many digits is the account number?
You'll be sent a seven-digit account number that will never change.
What can I do if my browser is not compatible?
You should update your browser to its latest version.
I need to check my browser compatibility.
To check for your browser compatibility yo should visit https://encryption.ny.gov/
Why would DMV ask me about my searches?
We need to verify the compliance of the dial-in Terms of Service.
Would the dial-in search account service be useful for an attorney?
Yes, attorneys are among our most common clients.
tell me about the dial-in search account website and browser compatibility
About the website, we can assure you that your data is safe thanks to our upgraded security protocols.
Can you give me a mailing address to contact the DMV about my dial-in search account?
the DMV contact address is NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137
where should I send the form for applying for an account?
you should send the form to Data Services - New Search AccountNYS Department of Motor Vehicles6 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228
The website says that my browser is not compatible.
We recommend you update your browser to its latest version.
How can I verify my browser compatibility?
You can verify your browser compatibility by visiting https://encryption.ny.gov/
How should I pay for my dial-in account fees?
Customers must include a deposit with the application and the first deposit should be enough to pay for the first 2 months of searches.
Can you repeat the address where I should send the form?
Yes, the address is Data Services - New Search AccountNYS Department of Motor Vehicles6 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228

Hi, I'm constantly searching DMV records for driver license, registration and insurance information. So I thought I'd get a DIAL-IN search account, but I need to fill the form MV-15D. I've been trying to get the form on the website but it's seems the website is down, or maybe my browser is not compatible. Could you assist me with that?

We are currently upgrading our security protocols to better protect your data, so the platform has been down recently, but right now the website if available. If you want to check whether your browser is compatible, visit https://encryption.ny.gov/.
Thanks, I checked and my browser it's not compatible, what should I do now?
Upgrade your browser to the latest version.
Done, so now to re-verify whether is compatible should I go to the same link?
Absolutely, visit https://encryption.ny.govc to verify again.
Thanks, I already got in, but I can't seem to download the form. How can I contact DMV about this? I need to get that Dial-in search acount asap.
You can contact DMV at: NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228 473 - 2137 dmvaccounts@gmail.com
Thanks! But why can't I download the form? Does it have anything to do with the new security?
Yes, we upgraded our security for better protection of the data. So, now you can't download any form as you usually did, to request a form you have to contact DMV.
Can I visit the page with mi phone?
Yes, most of smart phones have compatible browsers. Visit https://encryption.ny.gov/ to check that.
I've searched a motorist's records, will he know I did it?
Yes, he will be informed as search records are public records.
I had to pay a fee for using DIAL-IN search account, why?

According to the NYS Vehicle and Traffic Law, we must charge a fee to search DMV records.  It is a legal step that must be met by private persons, commercial organizations and not-for-profit organizations.
I have filled out and submitted the Motor Vehicle Record Search Account Application MV-15D form, how do I know if it was accepted?
If your application is complete, we will create an account and send you the number and password. The account is made up of a 7-digit number that will never change.
I have forgotten my Dial-in Search Account data, what should I do?
To solve your problem with your Dial-in Search Account, you must contact us at: NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany , NY 12228.
I understood that records of searches are private, is this true?
No, records of searches are public records.
Hey, i'm having some issues with your site not opening in my browser?
We are currently going through upgrade for our security protocols in order to offer you a better data protection.
Oh, i see. Yeah, tought you could be doing any of that, but wanted to be sure. Anyway, i wanted to go on some records searching, there is any fee involved if i use a Dial-In search?
Indeed, you have to pay a fee for search DMV records. Whether you are a private person, an commercial organization or an NGO, there is a fee for using that service, according to law.
Thanks. Can i pay that fee with my credit card?
No, sorry, but at the moment DMV isn't accepting any payments with credit cards.
Um, ok. Now back with browser issue, what about if i'm still having problems with your page after being updated?
In case that occurs, just update you browser to its newer version and try accessing once again.
I'll do that, thanks. One more question, if i request some searches being delivered to me via mail-order, do i need to pay  for them in which way, please?
In that case, you can use you account balance to make the corresponding payment for those mail-order searches.
I would like to know about DIAL-IN search account and can i get one?
DIAL-IN is a service provided to search regularly records that DMV has on driver license, registration, vehicle title or insurance information. If you need this service, then you can get one.
So that is all about the service?
Is that all i need to know about DIAL-IN service?Do i need to pay any fees to use this service?

Yes but you need to know about the permissible uses of DMV records. There are some limitations which you can view in more details at Drivers Privacy Protection Act DPPA [ 2 ] . The fee applied to private persons, commercial organizations and not - for - profit organizations. This is according to the NYS Vehicle and Traffic Law.
Do i need to prepare or keep any documents for the searches I perform?

Yes. You need to show records of business purpose of the search. These records may include invoices, employment applications and any other types of documents related to the purpose of the search. The DMV may request these documents according to the Term of Services of the Search Account.
What organizations are exempted from search fees?

Organizations that are exempted from the search fees are any public organizations and other private entities acting pursuant to section 722 of the New York State County Law that makes a search due to a public purpose.
What do I need to do if the DMV inquire me about a search that i did not perform?
If something like that happens, you first need to check whether other users of your account did the search. If that is not the case, you need to contact the DMV immediately to inform about this.
If I searched a motorist records, will the DMV tells the owner of the records?
Yes. This is because, the records of searches are public records and the DMW will inform the motorist if the motorist ask the DMV.
Do I need to check browser compability for DMV Dial-in Search Account?
Yes. Since our security protocols are currently updating, You need to make sure that your browser is compatible to use any of the state's government websites.
To do this, you can visit https://encryption.ny.gov/ [ 6 ] .
So, as long as my browser is compatible to use any of the state 's government websites, it should be compatible with the Dial-in Search Account?
Yes. Therefore, if it is not compatible, you just need to update it to the latest version.
Okay. So i do not need to switch to different kinds of browser?I just need to update to the latest version?
Can you give me some examples of business records that I must keep in order to document the searches?

Yes. Just update it. Examples of business records to keep can be invoices, retainer agreements and accident reports. These documents can be any kinds of document to justify the reason you perform your searches.
May i know how to contact you guys for my Dial-in Search Account?

There are few ways to contact us. You can always come to our physical location at NYS DMV DIAL - IN Accounts Room 2316 Empire State Plaza, Albany , NY 12228. You can also email us at [ email protected ] [ 5 ] .
How do i pay for the searches that i have done?
We would subtract the fee from the balance in your account.
Does security protocols update relates to browser compatibility?
Yes. In order to better protect your data, we need to update it. Updating the security protocols means that latest version of browser is needed to enable the updates to be executed.
will you tell a motorist if i search their records?
yes. records of searches are public records
did you ask the dmv if your records were searched?
Yes
the dmv supplies the name and business address of the DIAL - IN account holder
what about browser compatibility?
please visit https://encryption.ny.gov
how do i contact dmv about my dial-in search account?
you can contact use at : NYSDMV DIAL - IN AccountsRoom 2316 Empire State PlazaAlbany
what the area code
are there fees for using a dial-in search account?
there are some organizations that are exempt from search fees
what is their phone number?
Can you tell me how I will know if my application has been accepted?
Sure, we will have to review your application first.
We will let you know if it is not complete.
I believe it has all been filled out.
We will send your application back with what is wrong and give more instructions on what to do if something else is needed.
How do I pay for the DIAL-IN Search account fees?
You will pay those fees once we accept your application.
How do I know if there are fees for using a DIAL-IN search account?

Some organizations are exempt from search fees.  Any public organization , its officers , a volunteer fire company , a volunteer ambulance service , or a legal aid bureau or society or other private entity acting pursuant to section 722 of the New York State County Law , that makes a search for a public purpose, is exempt from the search fees.
How do I know if it's a public organization?
For more information, please visit our Escrow Accounts page.
How do I apply?
Go to Data Services - New Search Account  NYS Dept of Motor Vehicles.

Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning F.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning For Your Survivors | Social Security Administration#1_0

turns.utterance: I'm looking for information regarding benefits planning, can you help me?
Are you planning for your own future?
Yes I am
You need to think about what your family would do if you died now. Social Security can help your family, provided you have earned enough Social Security credits through your work
What are Social Security credits?
They are credits earned through your work and when you pay Social Security
What happens if the amount of spouse's benefit on my record is more than the widow's or widower's benefit on my Social Security record?
Is that's the case, they'll receive a combination of benefits which will total the higher amount in this instance
What happens if I don't have enough credits built up, do my children or spouse receive anything?
Your children and spouse can get benefits if you have credits built up for one and one-half years of work 6 credits in the three years just before your death
What if my surviving divorced spouse remarries?
They will continue to receive benefits on your Social Security record
What if my surviving spouse will be in receipt of a non-Social Security pension in the future, are their benefits going to be affected?
In this case, their benefits as a survivor may be affected, depending on what they will receive

Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning F.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning For Your Survivors | Social Security Administration#1_0

turns.utterance: Can you help me with planing the benefits for my survivors?
Are you planning for the future of your survivors?
Not right now.
But I want to know if my family would get any help from Social Security after my passing.
yes, Social Security can help your family if you have earned enough credits through your work.
And what about my widow, what benefits would she receive?

She can get reduced benefits as early as age 60 or full benefits at full retirement age. If she's 50 years old she could get the benefits if she's disabled and her disability started 7 years or earlier before your death.
what if she remarries after my death?
if she remarries after age 60, 50 if disabled, she would still qualify for the benefits on your social security records.
And if she receives a pension not covered by Social Security?
If it's a pension based on work then their Social Security benefits as a survivor could be affected.

Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning F.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning For Your Survivors | Social Security Administration#1_0

turns.utterance: I need help planning for my survivors.
Are you currently planning for the future of your survivors?
Yes, I am.
If you have earned enough Social Security credits, then Social Security can help your family should you die now.
Can my stepfather receive the benefits too?
He can if he became your stepfather before you turned 16.
How much my family members can get from the benefits?
there's a limit to the amount they can receive each month, but it varies. Normally is equal to between 150 and 180 percent of the basic benefit rate.
is the sum payable to your family members greater than this limit?
no, it isn't
Tell me about the credits I can earn through Social Security.
You can get up to four credits each year. You get 1 credit for every 1,360$ you earn during the year.
How much money would my survivors receive?
it depends on the average lifetime earnings you get. The higher your earnings the more they'll receive.

Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning F.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning For Your Survivors | Social Security Administration#1_0

turns.utterance: I want to know about planning Social Security benefits for the future in case I die.
Are you already planning for the future?
Yes, I am
Since you are already thinking about what your family would need in case you die, I can tell you that Social Security can help your family if you have earned enough credits through your work.
Tell me some of the things I need to know about it.
Well, one important thing is to know that there are limits on how much your survivors may earn while they receive the benefits.
Tell me about what would happen if my surviving divorced wife remarries after my death.
If she remarries before turning 60 then she won't be able to get the benefits while she is still married.
And what if she qualifies but the amount she could get from her new husband's Social Security benefits are more than what she would receive from mine?
then she should apply for her new husband's benefits and then she would receive a combination of benefits that would amount to be equal to the highest benefits amount.
What if I die before earning enough credits and my widow is still taking care of our children?
in that case, your children and widow would still receive the benefits, no matter if you didn't manage to earn enough credits.

Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning F.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning For Your Survivors | Social Security Administration#1_0

turns.utterance: can you tell me about planning for social security benefits for my survivors?
Are you currently planning for their future?
Not right now.
But just to know, what if I left a surviving divorced spouse?
If your marriage lasted for at least 10 years, then they could receive the same benefits as your widow or widower.
and, would social security actually help my family if I die?
Yes, if you earn enough social security credits then Social Security would help your survivors with the benefits you earn while working.
Could my widow apply for disability benefits after my death?
She would need to contact Social Security at 1-800-772-1213 . The process could get faster if she completes an Adult Disability Report before her appointment.
Please, tell me about the benefits she could get and at what age?

your widow could get reduced benefits as early as age 60 or full benefits at full retirement age. If she suffers from a disability, she could get the benefits as soon as she turns 50 if the disability started before your death or up to 7 years after your death.
What is the maximum amount my family can get from Social Security?
It varies, but there's a limit that's generally between 150 and 180 percent of the basic benefit rate.

Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning F.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning For Your Survivors | Social Security Administration#1_0

turns.utterance: Yes maybe you can help me with the forms for benefit planning?
Are you interested in planning for the future?
Yes I would like to prepare in the eventuality that I die.
If you have earned enough Social Security credits through your work, Social Security can help your family financially.
Would my partner benefit from this?
Yes if they have not remarried in the interim and if they take care of your child who is under age 16 or disabled and receives benefits on your record.
What if my spouse and I are divorced?
Are you divorced from them?
No we are merely separated.
How much is enough credits from work?
They can get benefits if you have credit for 12 to 18 months of work 6 credits in the three years just before your demise.

Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning F.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning For Your Survivors | Social Security Administration#1_0

turns.utterance: I need some information on benefits planning.
I can help you with this. Are you planning for your future?
No, I am planing for my wife Sally.
If Sally remarries after I die should she apply for my benefits?
Yes, she can.
What benefits will Sally get if we divorce before I die?
So she would be a surviving divorced spouse?
Yes, just trying to figure out her future without me.
Ok, I see. Sally would continue to receive the benefits after your death provided your marriage lasted 10 years or more.
I want to make sure that I plan for my family. How do I know if I have earned enough Social Security credits through my work?
Absolutely, planning for the future is always wise. We can discuss the credit limits.

Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning F.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Survivors | Planning For Your Survivors | Social Security Administration#1_0

turns.utterance: I want to know how to plan for the social security benefits for my survivors.
Are you currently planning for their future?
Yes, I am
then you can rest assured that they will receive Social Security help if you manage to earn enough social security benefits through your work.
would my wive get the benefits regardless of her age?
She would get the benefit no matter her age if she's disabled or it's still taking care of your child who is 16 years old or younger.
what's the minimum amount of credits needed for my wife to get the benefits while she's still taking care of my tuner age children?
you'd need to sum at least 6 credits in the three years just before your death
what if the amount my family members get paid is higher than the limits?
Then the benefits would be reduced proportionately. Benefits for disabled surviving spouse won't count for the maximum amount.
and what if my widow remarries after turning 60?
she'd still be able to receive the surviving benefits on your record.

Benefits Planner: Disability | How You A.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Disability | How You Apply | Social Security Administration#2_0

turns.utterance: Hi, I want to know how to apply for disabilty benefits for family members.
You'll need the Social Security numbers of each member of your family that may be eligible for benefits.
Is your spouse also applying for benefits?
No, that's not the case.
Do you have proof of the marriage?
Yes, I do.
What can I do in case I don't have all the required documents?
If you need the benefits now, don't delay applying for it, we'll help you get all the documents and information needed.
just in case my application is denied. Can I request an appeal?
we have a free TTY number for people with hearing impairments to request an appeal, 1 - 800 - 325 - 0778.
what info do I need to give to apply for the benefits?
You'll need some personal information and info like your Social Security number and proof of your age, medical records, etc.

Benefits Planner: Disability | How You A.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Disability | How You Apply | Social Security Administration#2_0

turns.utterance: I have recently become permanently disabled. How do I apply for Social Security?

To apply, you will have to provide information about yourself including your Social Security number, information about your health history including doctors names and addresses, dates of any hospital visits, and a list of medication and the dosage you take.
Do I need to provide any information about the others who live in my home?
Yes. If any other members of your household qualify for benefits, their social security numbers and proof of their ages will be needed.
Do I need a proof of marriage if my husband is applying for benefits, as well?
Yes. A proof of marriage is required if your spouse is applying for benefits too.
I'm not clear on whether or not I am qualified for benefits. Is there a place where I could get more information about this?
Yes, more information about this topic can be found in your SSI booklet on page 5 under "Your income and resources".
Is there any way that I can get additional help on applying for disability?
Yes, our Disability Starter Kit is available to all adults and children under 18. This kit will help aid you in getting ready for your online application and disability interview.
If I'm turned down for disability, can I appeal?
Yes. You can contact Social Security if you are denied. If you have a hearing disability, you can call toll free at 1-800-0778.

Benefits Planner: Disability | How You A.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Disability | How You Apply | Social Security Administration#2_0

turns.utterance: What can I do if my application for disability benefits is denied?
We can deny your application if we decide you don't meet the requirements to get the benefits after reviewing your application. But, you have the right to ask for a second review.
So if I disagree with your decision I can ask for y application to be reviewed again?
Yes, and in the notice you receive after getting your application denied, you can see the instructions on how to appeal the decision.
and, as a person with hearing problems, do you offer any suitable form of contact?
yes, we have the toll-free TTY number 1-800-325-0778
Can you give me some publications about disability benefits?
Sure, I recommend you read the publications "Apply Online For Disability Benefits", "Disability Benefits" and "Disability Starter Kit".
Thanks. And again, about appealing a denied decision. Is there anything to do if my decision is denied a second time?
If we decide you don't qualify because you are not disabled according to our rules, you can appeal online.
Was your application denied?
No, I'm just curious, just in case.
now, can you tell me about SSI?
the Supplemental Security Income or SSI it's the option you would get if you didn't manage to get enough Social Security credits to qualify for the disability benefits.

Benefits Planner: Disability | How You A.doc_id: Benefits Planner: Disability | How You Apply | Social Security Administration#2_0

turns.utterance: What can I do if my disability benefits application is denied?
if your application is denied is due to, after reviewing your case, we decide that you don't meet the requirements for disability benefits. But you can appeal our decision.
Do you disagree with our decision?
Yes, what can I do now?
you have the right to ask for another review. In the denial notification you receive, you can see the instructions to appeal the decision.
what would happen if I don't have enough social security credits to qualify for disability benefits?
In that case, you can still qualify for Supplemental Security Income (SSI) if you have limited income and resources.
do you have any TTY number for deaf people?
Yes, we have the toll-free TTY number 1-800-325-0778
Can a deaf person request an appeal through that TTY number?
Yes, they can.
Where can I get more information about SSI?
You can read our Supplemental Security Income SSI booklet in the section "Your income and resources" on page 5.
